eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allows adding discord rich presence to your games. Only works on Windows/Mac/Linux exports. To test it on a preview, restart the discord desktop client while GDevelop is already opened, and start a preview.

You can get more infos on each field via [the discord documentation](https://discord.com/developers/docs/rich-presence/how-to#updating-presence-update-presence-payload-fields).
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DiscordRichPresence
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds discord rich presence to your games.

eventsFunctions.description: Attempts to connect to discord if it is installed, and initialize rich presence.
eventsFunctions.name: ConnectToDiscord

eventsFunctions.description: Update the data in the rich presence. See the discord documentation for more info on each field. Each field except state is optional.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateRichPresence
eventsFunctions.sentence: Update rich presence to state _PARAM1_, details _PARAM2_, begin timestamp _PARAM3_, end timestamp _PARAM4_, large image _PARAM5_ with text _PARAM6_ and small image _PARAM7_ with text _PARAM8_

parameters.description: The details of the current state
parameters.name: details

parameters.description: The timstamp of the start of the match
parameters.longDescription: If this is filled, discord will show the time elapsed since the start.
parameters.name: startTimestamp

parameters.description: The timestamp of the end of the match
parameters.longDescription: If this is filled, discord will display the remaining time.
parameters.name: endTimestamp

parameters.description: The name of the big image
parameters.name: largeImageKey

parameters.description: The text of the large image
parameters.name: largeImageText

parameters.description: The name of the small image
parameters.name: smallImageKey

parameters.description: The text of the small image
parameters.name: smallImageText

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Text to Speech extension allows you to use the system's Text-to-Speech features to read any text aloud.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TextToSpeech
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: An extension to enable the use of Text-to-Speech features.

eventsFunctions.description: Speaks a text message aloud through the system text-to-speech.
eventsFunctions.name: Speak
eventsFunctions.sentence: Say _PARAM1_ with voice _PARAM2_, volume _PARAM3_%, rate _PARAM4_% and pitch _PARAM5_%

parameters.longDescription:
Voices vary depending on the operating system. 
Here is a list of windows voice names: https://bit.ly/windows-voices 
And here is a list of voice names for MacOS: https://bit.ly/mac-voices
parameters.name: Voice

eventsFunctions.description: Forces all Text-to-Speech to be stopped.
eventsFunctions.name: StopSpeaking

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Silver-Streak
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allow you to check for double-clicks with the left, middle, or right button of a mouse. It will also allow you to detect double-taps on touchscreens. 

Please note: Touch devices do not have alternatives for middle/right clicks. Taps on a touch device will get counted for _any_ use of these conditions, so you should either design your controls accordingly, or build out separate events if the device has a touch screen.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DoubleClick
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_mouse_wireless_pc.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Check for a double-click with a mouse, or a double-tap on a touchscreen.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified mouse button is clicked twice in a short amount of time.
eventsFunctions.name: HasDoubleClicked
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ mouse button is double-clicked (or double-tap on a touchscreen)

parameters.longDescription: As touch devices do not have middle/right tap equivalents, you will need to account for this within your events if you're not using the left mouse button and building for touch devices.
parameters.name: MouseButton

eventsFunctions.description: Set the maximum delay between two clicks (or two taps) to be considered as a double click.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxDelay
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the double-click maximum delay between two clicks (or two taps) to _PARAM1_s

parameters.longDescription: By default, this value is 0.5 seconds.
parameters.name: MaxDelay

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Draws a draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
The value range, tick spacing, and the appearance of the slider can be defined with properties.

How to use:
- Add this behavior a **Shape Painter** object
- Place an instance of that shape painter on the screen where you want the slider to appear
- Use the "Value" expression to find the Value based on the position of the slider

Tips:
- You can disable the slider to prevent a user from interacting with it
- You can set the Value of the slider and the slider will move to the correct position

Further details can be found in [this tutorial video](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs).

Breaking changes (1.0.0)
- Track thickness and length properties replaced track width and height. These 2 properties must be set again if they were different from the default size.
- Hidden sliders can be dragged. The "enable" action must be used to disable them.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let users select a numerical value by dragging a slider.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggableSliderControl

events.comment: Make sure object doesn't get re-drawn every frame
Use correct min value (instead of always starting at 0)
Set track height function (which enforces valid thumb sizes)
Start halo at same size as thumb
Track where the mouse is (in relation to object)
Move slider when being dragged
End sliding and update variables
Update "Value" based on the location of the thumb
Grow halo even more when pressed
Detect hover/touch/click (but only if the layer and object is visible, and the object is not already being dragged)
Detect mouse clicks near track, start dragging
Reset hover detection
Grow halo when hovered
Shrink halo to zero when not hovered
Redraw slider only when halo is not at final size
Set inactive track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw inactive track
Draw half circle at end of track (inactive side)
Set active track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw active track (2 pixels bigger than property)
Draw half circle at end of track (active side)
Prepare halo
Draw halo (it will grow or shrink as needed)
Use a more opaque halo while being dragged (it will grow or shrink as needed)
Prepare thumb settings
Draw Circle thumb
Draw Rectangle thumb

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Make object pushable or/and pullable by another object.  

- Support **single** box object.
- Support **multi** box objects.
- User can set the weight of the box.
- Option (Yes/No) to make the boxes overlap.  

# Conditions
- Check if object is pushing.
- Check if object is pulling.  

# Actions
- Make objectA pushable by objectB.
- Make objectA Pullable by objectB.

# Example
![](https://i.imgur.com/C9HKvkz.png)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PushableAndPullableBox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Convert object to a pushable or/and pullable box.

eventsFunctions.description: Make object pushable by platformer character object.
eventsFunctions.name: Pushing

events.name: Player coming from left side of box
Player coming from right side of box

parameters.longDescription: This object will push the box.
parameters.name: Player

parameters.longDescription: The higher the value the lighter the box.
parameters.name: Weight

parameters.description: Boxes can overlap when being pushed into each other horizontally
parameters.name: Overlap

parameters.longDescription:
Select **any object** if you set the overlap to **Yes**.  
Select your **floor object** if you set the overlap to **No**.
parameters.name: Floor

parameters.longDescription:
-Set it to the same first **box object** if you **only have 1 box object**.  
-Set it to a **group of box objects** if you have **more than 1 box object**.
parameters.name: MultiBoxes

eventsFunctions.description: Make object pullable by platformer character object.
eventsFunctions.name: Pulling

events.name: Player coming from left side of box
Player coming from right side of box

parameters.longDescription: This object will pull the box.
parameters.name: Player

parameters.longDescription: The higher the value the lighter the box.
parameters.name: Weight

parameters.longDescription:
The distance between player and box object must be below this number in order to pull the box.  
Example: 10.
parameters.name: Distance

parameters.longDescription:
-Set it to the same first **box object** if you **only have 1 box object**.  
-Set it to a **group of box objects** if you have **more than 1 box object**.
parameters.name: MultiBoxes

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the player object is pushing.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPushing

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the player object is pulling.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPulling

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
# This extension has been reworked   
You can install the new reworked version by searching the name:  
**Pushable/Pullable Box**
---
Extension to make object work as a pushable box  
Requires: Platformer character behavior, Platformer behavior  
-Player can push and move the object.  
-Player can stand on the object.  
-User can set the "weight" of the box.  
-User can set the moving keys of the object.  
-User have the option to go through box or not.  
-User can use up to 3 boxes.  

*Remember:  
-You can change the box (acceleration & deceleration) from the platformer character behavior.  
-Extension action can be used ONCE only.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PushableBox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Makes an object a pushable box.

eventsFunctions.description: Make any object a pushable box.
eventsFunctions.name: PushableBox1Object

events.comment:
-Variable to store the player speed
-Take jump ability from the box object
-Set the box object to jumpthrough platform
-Take the movment control from the box object
Move the box right when the player move right taking into account both the player and the box speed
If the entered weight is higher than the player maximum speed > set the box and the player weight to player maximum speed
If the entered weight is lower than the player maximum speed > set the box and the player weight to the entered value
Move the box left when the player move left taking into account both the player and the box speed
If the entered weight is higher than the player maximum speed > set the box and the player weight to player maximum speed
If the entered weight is lower than the player maximum speed > set the box and the player weight to the entered value

parameters.longDescription:
The higher the value the lighter the box, 
Maximum box speed = player maximum speed
parameters.name: Weight

parameters.description: Player can go through the box ?
parameters.longDescription: When the box is stuck (not moving).
parameters.name: GoThroughBox

eventsFunctions.description: Make any object a pushable box.
eventsFunctions.name: PushableBox2Objects

parameters.longDescription:
The higher the value the lighter the box, 
Maximum box speed = Player maximum speed
parameters.name: Weight

parameters.longDescription:
The higher the value the lighter the box, 
Maximum box speed = Player maximum speed
parameters.name: Box2Weight

parameters.description: Player can go through the box ?
parameters.longDescription: When the box is stuck (not moving).
parameters.name: GoThroughBox

eventsFunctions.description: Make any object a pushable box.
eventsFunctions.name: PushableBox3Objects

parameters.longDescription:
The higher the value the lighter the box, 
Maximum box speed = Player maximum speed
parameters.name: Weight

parameters.longDescription:
The higher the value the lighter the box, 
Maximum box speed = Player maximum speed
parameters.name: Box2Weight

The higher the value the lighter the box, 
Maximum box speed = Player maximum speed

parameters.longDescription: When the box is stuck (not moving).
parameters.name: GoThroughBox

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Ahnaf30e
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Adds expressions to get the current FPS and a behavior to display the current FPS easily.

The FPS, Frames Per Second, describes how many times in the last second your game got updated. An update consists in running all the behaviors, objects, and events sheet code, before rendering the new game state into the game window. The higher the FPS, the more it manages to update in a second, influencing how fluid and performant your game looks.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FPS
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds expressions and a behavior to get and display the game FPS.

eventsFunctions.description: Return your game's current FPS count.
eventsFunctions.name: FPS

eventsFunctions.description: Return your game's current FPS count, with more control over rounding.
eventsFunctions.name: PreciseFPS

parameters.longDescription: This tells how many numbers after the period should be shown.
parameters.name: accuracy

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Makes a text object display the current FPS.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FPSDisplayer

propertyDescriptors.label: The prefix before the FPS count
propertyDescriptors.name: prefix

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
With this extension, you can load images from any URL (including a DataURL) into a sprite or image resource.
Loading it into a sprite will load the URL into a sprite, replacing the image it displays until the sprite's displayed image is changed, e.g. by going to the next frame of an animation or switching animations.
Loading it into a resource will discard the old image that a resource was using and replace it with the image loaded from a URL. Any sprite that is displaying this resource as a part of their animation will start showing the new image instead of the  old one. The old image of the resource will not be accessible anymore unless you restart the game or reload the original image from a URL into it.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LoadImageFromURL
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds multiple actions to load images from a URL into the game.

eventsFunctions.description: Replaces the image contained by a sprite by a new one, from a URL. This will only affect the sprite in question and only until the image in it is changed through its animation or another action, unless you also modify the resource.
eventsFunctions.name: LoadURLIntoSprite
eventsFunctions.sentence: Load URL _PARAM1_ into sprite _PARAM2_ (and into the corresponding resource: _PARAM3_)

parameters.description: The URL to load the new image for the sprite from
parameters.name: URL

parameters.longDescription: If yes, modifies the image contained in the resource of the sprite's current frame instead of just the sprite's displayed image. This makes the changes affect all other sprites that also display this resource, and allows the change to persist after changing animations or the current frame.
parameters.name: ChangeResource

eventsFunctions.description: Replaces the image contained by a resource by a new one, from a URL. This will update all sprites displaying the resource.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Load URL into an image resource
eventsFunctions.name: LoadURLIntoImageResource

parameters.description: The URL to load the new image for the resource from
parameters.name: URL

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This uses the Crypto API to create a random number see help for more details. 

You might ask how this differs from the built-in random functions in GDevelop like RandomInRange. In basic terms, it provides a more random number than Math.random() which is what the built-in functions use.
That randomness does come at a cost of performance so be aware of your usage of this. 

**This has nothing to do with crypto currency**
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CryptoApi
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Random number generator for integers and floats using the Crypto API.

eventsFunctions.description: Uses the Crypto API to create a longer random number in an integer range.
eventsFunctions.name: RandomInRange

eventsFunctions.description: Uses the Crypto API to create a longer random number in an float range.
eventsFunctions.name: RandomFloatInRange

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, @arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.

Find the list of cursors here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CursorType
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeCursorType

events.comment:
Set as variable instead of directly setting as a CursorHover behavior can override it.
By using a variable, we ensure to be able to change it back to that "default" after the override is over.

parameters.longDescription: List of available cursors on https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor
parameters.name: cursor_type

events.comment: Reset ordering as the object with highest Z-Order might not exist anymore or be not be hovered anymore.
Set default value of the default cursor if the variable has just been created

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change the cursor appearence when the object is hovered (on Windows, macOS or Linux).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: CursorHover

events.comment: Check the z Order to ensure the cursor shown is the one from the foremost object

propertyDescriptors.label: The cursor type
propertyDescriptors.description: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor for a list of possible cursors.
propertyDescriptors.name: cursor_type

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Add this behavior to a shape painter object.

When the toggle switch is in the *left* position, the condition `Checked` is "false". If it is in the *right* position, the condition `Checked` is true.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the toggle switch.

Toggle switch cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Toggle switch is hidden
- Toggle switch's layer is hidden
- Toggle switch is disabled

Toggle switch can always be changed by an action.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ToggleSwitch
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Toggle switch that users can click or touch.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Use a shape-painter object to draw a toggle switch that users can click or touch.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ToggleSwitch

events.comment: Fix bad inputs that create malformed toggle switches
Animate the thumb to the right place
Detect hover/touch/click (but only if the layer and object is visible, and the object is not already being dragged)
Detect mouse clicks near track, start dragging
Reset scene variable
Set inactive track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw half circle at end (optional)
Draw inactive track
Set active track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw half circle at end (optional)
Draw active track
Draw halo when the mouse is hovering over thumb
Use darker halo while being pressed
Drop Shadow
Prepare thumb settings
Draw Circle thumb
Make sure object doesn't get re-drawn every frame

propertyDescriptors.label: Color string for the track that is RIGHT of the thumb. Example:  150;150;150  (Leave blank to use thumb color)
propertyDescriptors.name: InactiveTrackColor

propertyDescriptors.label: Opacity of the track that is RIGHT of the thumb.  Example: 255
propertyDescriptors.name: InactiveTrackOpacity

propertyDescriptors.label: Color string for the track that is LEFT of the thumb. Example:  24;119;211 (Leave blank to use thumb color)
propertyDescriptors.name: ActiveTrackColor

propertyDescriptors.label: Opacity of the track that is LEFT of the thumb.  Example: 128
propertyDescriptors.name: ActiveTrackOpacity

propertyDescriptors.label: Size of halo when the mouse hovers and clicks on the thumb. Example: 24
propertyDescriptors.name: HaloRadius

propertyDescriptors.label: Opacity of halo when the mouse hovers on the thumb. Example: 32
propertyDescriptors.name: HaloOpacityHover

propertyDescriptors.label: Opacity of the halo that appears when the toggle switch is pressed. Example: 64
propertyDescriptors.name: HaloOpacityPressed

propertyDescriptors.label: Number of pixels the thumb is from the left side of the track.
propertyDescriptors.name: ThumbOffset

propertyDescriptors.label: State has been changed (used in ToggleChecked function)
propertyDescriptors.name: ToggleChanged

propertyDescriptors.label: Click or press has started on toggle switch
propertyDescriptors.name: IsPressed

propertyDescriptors.label: Offset (Y) of shadow on thumb.  Positive numbers move shadow down, negative numbers move shadow up. Example: 4
propertyDescriptors.name: ThumbShadowOffsetY

propertyDescriptors.label: Offset (X) of shadow on thumb.  Positive numbers move shadow right, negative numbers move shadow left. Example: 0
propertyDescriptors.name: ThumbShadowOffsetX

propertyDescriptors.label: Opacity of shadow on thumb. Example: 32
propertyDescriptors.name: ThumbShadowOpacity

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Loads a (static) JSON resource from your project files into a global, scene, or object variable.

NEVER use this to load your game.json into a variable - this would increase your game size by a lot and make your whole project file available for anyone to open!
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: JSONResourceLoader
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Loads a JSON resource into a variable.

eventsFunctions.description: Loads a JSON resource into a scene structure variable.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Load a JSON resource in a scene variable
eventsFunctions.name: LoadJSONToScene

parameters.description: The resource to load the JSON from
parameters.name: Resource

parameters.description: The scene variable to load the JSON to
parameters.name: Variable

eventsFunctions.name: LoadJSONToGlobal

parameters.description: The resource to load the JSON from
parameters.name: Resource

parameters.description: The global variable to load the JSON to
parameters.name: Variable

eventsFunctions.name: LoadJSONToObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Load _PARAM1_ into object variable _PARAM3_ of object _PARAM2_

parameters.description: The resource to load the JSON from

parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: The object variable to load the JSON to

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Lim98SE
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension provide two behaviors:

- Turn object into cursor
Make the object as the new cursor

- Clickable button 
Provide a new condition on the object for fast checking is this one has been clicked.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MouseHelper
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_mouse_wireless.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Check if a sprite has been clicked and turn any objects into a cursor.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: An easy way to turn any object into a mouse cursor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: cursor

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Turns any object into a button, useful to know if it has been clicked with a simple object condition.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: button

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: isClicked
